blog.title: Welcome to my blog.
blog.description: I'm simply a tumblr user that has an interest in many fictional verses. I normally talk about Blazblue, Guilty Gear--well many video games in general that interest me. Movies I enjoy is the Marvel Cinematic Universe. :D Huge fan of characters like Doctor Strange, Black Panther, and Iron Man. I'm pretty much open to anything. Originally heavily Guilty Gear-themed, but I changed it to expand myself on this site. In case you're wondering about the character all over my blog, her name is Ramlethal Valentine. Don't mind her, I just...love her. :3

tags: the hardest choices require the strongest wills
summary: If the Avengers plan to make their own gauntlet, why does Iron Man need another suit to wield the stones when he can simply make...
question: If the Avengers plan to make their own gauntlet, why does Iron Man need another suit to wield the stones when he can simply make a simple gauntlet/glove?
answer:
The Gauntlet acquires two things. One, you must have strong willpower. Two, your body must be strong enough to handle its power. Also, the gauntlet needs a crapload of energy. The bigger the capacity of energy produced, the greater the output is. 

Unfortunately, too much of that said energy will result in damaging the gauntlet and also potentially kill you in the process. Thanos was able to wield the gauntlet perfectly because he himself has great willpower and a strong body. Iron Man’s armor could match that as it holds massive amounts of energy and the source of it all is the Arc Reactor. The armor serves as protection, but the extent is unknown depending on what the armor is made of.

That is why Stark would need to obtain the same material of the Gauntlet from Eitri (assuming he is still alive) along with the help of Nebula and Thor. If he gets his hands on that stuff, he’ll be able to create possibly the most powerful armor ever known–more powerful than Bleeding Edge Armor! 

But as said in my previous posts, this is just a theory. Take it with a small grain of salt.
